Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Mission Critical
b) Defect Observed: Flap extension asymmetry. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Contamination ingress through damaged seal assembly
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Landing Gear component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Update technical documentation with lessons learned
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
